name: Overview
main:
Insecurity persists in northern and central Mali. Tensions between two of the signatories of the 2015 peace deal, the Azawad Movement Coalition (CMA) and the Groupe Autodéfense Touareg Imghad et Alliés (GATIA), periodically flare into conflict.  Attacks by Islamist armed groups, who are not part of the peace agreement, increased in 2016 and continued in 2017. 

Overall, a lack of access to basic social services and the low presence and capacity of public administration drives humanitarian needs. IDPs and refugees have slowly been returning home, but as of May 2017, over 52,000 people are internally displaced and more than 140,000 refugees remain in neighbouring countries.?

INFORM measures Mali's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 6/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity and vulnerability are all at alarming levels, at 5.3/10, 6.8/10 and 6/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past:
19/10: Over 500 schools remain closed across Mali; the school year started at the beginning of October. Islamist armed groups continue to threaten teachers and attack secular schools. ??

18/10: ICRC suspended activities in Kidal following attacks on the residences of ICRC personnel the night of 15 October. ?
